question_text: Why does assigning ports to different VLANs on a single switch result in multiple broadcast domains?
answer_options: Each VLAN is a logically separate network, each with its own broadcast domain
Switches always combine all traffic by default
Broadcasts are filtered by port number, not VLAN ID
correct_answer: Each VLAN is a logically separate network, each with its own broadcast domain
explanation: VLANs segment a switch into multiple logical networks; broadcasts are limited to devices within the same VLAN.
